result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew J Plew was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge 
Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. 
Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if imposed.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Villageof Pewaukee Police Department. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

ATTEND a Victim Impact Panel Meeting as a condition of probation. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith.
Defendant to serve 70 Hours of Community Service for Each Year of Probation as directed by agent.

Defendant Matthew J Plew in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Squad Car Video unscannable.
Stored in record center.

Defendant Matthew J Plew in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court addresses the positive WCS report and the Court calls the case to address the motion to suppress filed by Attorney Powers.  The State calls Officer Brian Foth from the Village of Pewaukee Police Department.  The officer is sworn in and the State conducts direct examination of the witness.  Exhibit #1 (Squad Car Video) was marked and moved into evidence by the State.  The Court admits Exhibit #1 into evidence. Cross examination by Attorney Powers.  Re-direct by the State.  The witness is excused.  The State rests.  The State conducts closing Statements.  Attorney Powers conducts closing Statements.  The Court denies the motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.  The trial remains as set.  Attorney Powers advises the Court that it is in the process of securing a witness.  If the witness is not available then the parties are to discuss a mutually acceptable trial date for both parties.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress or Dismiss.

COURT ORDERED A $500.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $1,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.
